benchmark_details.name: Jailbreak Distillation (JBDISTILL)
benchmark_details.overview: Jailbreak Distillation (JBDISTILL) is a novel benchmark construction framework that distills jailbreak attacks into high-quality and easily-updatable safety benchmarks, addressing challenges in existing safety evaluations by ensuring fair comparisons and reproducibility.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Provide a renewable safety evaluation framework for large language models.

data.source: Derived prompts from existing jailbreak attack algorithms and development models.
data.annotation: Minimal human effort required for running the JBDISTILL pipeline to produce updated benchmarks.

methods: Prompt selection algorithms (RANK BYSUCCESS, BESTPERGOAL, COMBINED SELECTION)
methodology.calculation: Average Attack Success Rate (ASR) across evaluation models to measure effectiveness; confidence intervals for separability.
methodology.interpretation: Effective benchmarks are those that provide high ASR and clear separability between model performances.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline benchmarks include HarmBench, DAN prompts, WildJailbreaks, showing lower effectiveness compared to JBDISTILL.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation of benchmark performance across diverse LLMs.

targeted_risks.harm: Adversarial prompts intended for safety evaluation, with a focus on preventing harmful applications.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: HarmBench dataset is under MIT license; WildJailbreaks dataset is under ODC-BY license.
